definition: unexpectedly/unawareness/unpreparedness
(negative prefix)/not/no
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]
idea/meaning/thought/to think/wish/desire/intention/to expect/to anticipate
to do sth when least expected (idiom); to catch sb off guard
to catch an enemy off guard with a surprise attack (idiom, from Sunzi's "The Art of War" 孫子兵法|孙子兵法[Sun1 zi3 Bing1 fa3])
pinyin: chu1 qi2 bu4 yi4 , gong1 qi2 bu4 bei4

sentences.english: It will happen by surprise in any place and time.
sentences.chinese: 它会随时随地且出奇不意地发生。

sentences.english: Don't give away your positions until you see the mammoth. He's the one to surprise.
sentences.chinese: 没见到毛象之前别暴露你们自己，我们得出其不意。

sentences.english: The police crept up from behind and took the gangster by surprise.
sentences.chinese: 警察悄悄从背后绕过去，出其不意地将歹徒逮捕。

sentences.english: The police issued an identikit picture of the mugger.
sentences.chinese: 警察印发出其不意行凶抢劫者的形象拼图。
他出其不意地使我招认了。

sentences.english: He jabbed me in the body.
sentences.chinese: 他出其不意地撞我的身体。

sentences.english: Vanish roller coaster at Cosmo Land in Japan unexpectedly dives into an underwater tunnel.
sentences.chinese: 日本大世界过山车会出其不意的驶进水下隧道里。

sentences.english: Shiki muses that death is always abrupt.
sentences.chinese: 志贵明白了死亡总是出其不意来临的。

sentences.english: The police surprised the thief into confessing.
sentences.chinese: 警察出其不意地使小偷招认了。

sentences.english: These approaches often have a smooth unexpected beneficial effect.
sentences.chinese: 这些办法都能有一些出其不意的好效果。

sentences.english: The truth must be elicited by surprise.
sentences.chinese: 必须出其不意，才能套出真情。

sentences.english: Love is steading a kiss when you stop before at the red light.
sentences.chinese: 爱是，等候红灯时的一个出其不意的吻。

sentences.english: To take in surprise criticism more productively, we need a game plan.
sentences.chinese: 想要很好的接受出其不意的批评，我们需要一个策略。

sentences.english: I walked all the way from home to the library, only to find it closed.
sentences.chinese: 我从家里一起走到藏书楼，不意已关门了。

sentences.english: Business environments are ever-changing, with problems often popping up unexpectedly.
sentences.chinese: 商业环境一直在变化，出其不意的问题会不断冒出。

definition: who would have thought that/who would have expected that
see 出其不意，攻其不備|出其不意，攻其不备[chu1 qi2 bu4 yi4 , gong1 qi2 bu4 bei4]
see 出其不意，攻其不備|出其不意，攻其不备[chu1 qi2 bu4 yi4 , gong1 qi2 bu4 bei4]
to exceed all expectations/to come as a surprise
to not anticipate/to not expect/unanticipated/unexpected
variant of 哪知[na3 zhi1]
to expect/to presume/to think (sth is likely)
suddenly/abruptly
who would have imagined?/unexpectedly
to seize an opportunity/to exploit (a loophole)
who would have thought?/who could have imagined?/unexpectedly
variant of 倉促|仓促[cang1 cu4]
turned out other than expected (idiom); unexpected
unprepared/off guard
to face the enemy/to meet an attack
certain/to know for sure
